metadata.title: Windows Server Hybrid Infrastructure
metadata.subtitle: Master Hybrid Infrastructure Management
metadata.description: Become an expert in Windows Server hybrid infrastructure, mastering high availability, disaster recovery, migration, and advanced infrastructure management in hybrid environments.

overview.summary: Windows Server Hybrid Infrastructure training prepares you for the AZ-801 certification by mastering hybrid infrastructure management, including high availability, disaster recovery, migration, and advanced Windows Server features.
overview.targetAudience: Infrastructure administrators, system engineers, and IT professionals who manage Windows Server hybrid infrastructures in enterprise environments.

sections.content:
High Availability Architecture

High availability ensures business continuity by implementing redundant systems and automatic failover capabilities for critical Windows Server workloads.

sections.content:
Disaster Recovery Strategy

Comprehensive disaster recovery ensures data protection and business continuity through backup, replication, and recovery solutions integrated with Azure.

sections.content: Infrastructure migration enables organizations to modernize their Windows Server environments while maintaining business continuity and optimizing costs.

Hybrid Monitoring

Hybrid monitoring provides unified visibility and security management across on-premises and Azure environments using integrated monitoring and security tools.

faq.question: Do I need physical servers for labs?
faq.answer: No, all labs are conducted in virtual environments. We provide access to Azure VMs and on-premises virtual labs for hands-on practice.

faq.question: Is this course technical?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a highly technical course requiring Windows Server administration experience and understanding of infrastructure concepts.

faq.question: What clustering technologies are covered?
faq.answer: The course covers Windows Server Failover Clustering, Network Load Balancing, Storage Spaces Direct, and stretched cluster configurations.

faq.question: Will I learn about Azure migration tools?
faq.answer: Yes, the course includes Azure Migrate, Azure Site Recovery, and various migration tools for moving Windows Server workloads to Azure.
